title: Relay Race
description: Puppy will go through a relay race and at each stop they will have to do one action
instruction: Lay 3 objects out on the floor
Go to each object and ask for one position (ie. sit, stand, down)
goal: To have puppy respond to cue next to the handler

title: Perch with Kibble
description: Puppy will perch on an object with kibble on it
instruction: Grab a box or small stool
Put kibble on top of object
Perch away!
*tip* if you think puppy will eat it, tape the kibble to the object

title: Heel and Side
description: Stand and cue your puppy for Heel and Side
instruction: Stand still and use only your voice
Say Heel puppy will go to your left side and sit
Say Side puppy will go to your right side and sit
Puppy should only cross in front of you
If puppy sits too far try doing this by a wall
challenge: Say side or heel twice in a row and see what your pup does

title: Duration Sit, Down, Stand
instruction: Cue the puppy
...Patiently wait
say Yes before they break
challenge: Distract puppy as they hold the position (be creative)

title: Dress Up
description: Have family members dress up in costumes or sports gear or hats and sunglasses and move around the house; Be wierd for your puppy.
instruction: Find strange things
put them on and interact with your puppy

title: Obstacle Course
description: You know ninja warrior? Try puppy warrior
instruction: Be creative
Take your chairs and make a tunnel for the puppy to go through
Put around some empty milk jugs
Put tin foil on the floor for your puppy to walk on
Hang up some things that brush against your puppy
challenge: See if you can make it through the course :)

title: Move Furniture
description: Move around familiar things. Some dogs are thrown off by changes in familiar environments
instruction: Move their dog bed
Change where they have dinner
Move the welcome mat to the bedroom door
The list goes on

title: Hide and Seek
description: Put puppy into a position (sit, stand, down, etc.). Get puppy to find you
instruction: Put puppy into position
Sneakily move around the house and hide
Remember to keep it easy the first few times, set up the pup for success
Call out to your puppy using a command that breaks position, ie. puppy puppy!
challenge: Sneakily move around the house and backtrack. I think the puppies listen to where you go. Play some music or sprinkle some kibble on the ground

title: Impressions
description: Change your voice and see if your puppy responds
instruction: Do your best (or worst) impression
Give command to puppy
challenge: Change the pitch and tone of your voice too. Be excited, be sad, be an actor/actress

title: Make Strange Noises
description: Make noises, remember not to startle your puppy. Aim for interest
instruction: Whistle
Play random music. Sometimes I play the sound of bacon frying
Whistle, make bird noises
Bang pots and pans
Run the vacuum

title: Feeding Time
description: Make your puppy work for their food
instruction: Feed puppy from slow feeder, stuffed kong, snuffle mat or hand feed
challenge: Say a command and see if they stop eating. Reward if they do :)

title: Kibble Challenge
description: have your puppy sit still while you write their name in kibble
instruction: Set your puppy in a position (sit, down, stand)
Use kibble and write their name on the floor
Keep it easy and take photos, you can hand feed periodically and say "good"
clean up the mess and give your puppy a treat!
goal: Teach puppy not to eat food off the ground and self-control
challenge: Can your puppy do this in a stand?

title: Kibble on Body
description: have your puppy be still while you put kibble on their body
instruction: Set your puppy in a down position
Put kibble on the top of their paws and say mine so they do not eat it
Say Release and let them eat the kibble!
challenge: Put it all over their body! Extra points for the head and nose. Make sure the food doesn't fall onto the floor when you say release

title: Rolling balls
description: Roll balls around puppy and they should not react
instruction: Roll ball
When puppy does not react, treat!
If puppy is ball-driven, avoid this one
goal: Teach puppy ball are not a bid deal
challenge: Roll more balls and other objects!

title: Find It
description: Have puppy search for toy for a treat
instruction: Get puppy exited about their favorite chew toy
Cue puppy into a position
Hide the toy close by
Say find it, when puppy finds the toy get really excited and treat!
challenge: Hide it in harder places, within reason...

title: Traffic Light Game
description: Have puppy respond to commands like sit, stand, down as they move towards you
instruction: Cue puppy into a position and walk away
Call puppy over, (ie. puppy puppy, here, release)
As puppy comes towards you say a command and they should stop and execute it
Click or say yes then treat!
goal: Puppy executes cues at a distance
challenge: do multiple cues per game (ie. sit, release, down, release, here, Yes!

title: Bed/Kennel Relay
description: Cue puppy towards you or into a position then reward at the bed or kennel
instruction: Give puppy cue
Mark behaviour then throw treat to the kennel or bed
Repeat and laugh as you bounce the puppy back and forth
Improve your aim and don't throw it onto the floor
challenge: Leave kibble on the ground for them to avoid or do this from a greater distance

title: Food Bag Foraging
description: Let puppy forage for food in the food bag
instruction: This one is quite complex find the detailed guide @ https://hydrant.pads.ca/food-bag-foraging/
Cue puppy into position
Set yo an empty food bag with a few kibble inside
Release the puppy or use Go Sniff command
Try to recall your puppy
If they do not respond, try using less enticing items in the bag
goal: Teach puppy explicit permission and have them be comfortable in enclosed spaces. Also teach puppy to listen to commands in the presence of food
challenge: Add better food in the bag

title: This Way
description: Get the puppy to move in your general direction when you say the cue
instruction: Cue the puppy into position (sit, stand, down)
Say this way move away
If puppy leaves position and moves towards you, mark and treat
goal: Have a good command to use to recall puppy. This is less formal than lets go or here
challenge: Change your voice or wear silly clothing
